title: CANFIELD | Trustee, schools candidates
text:
Address: 4000 Fox Lane, Canfield. 
Employment: Self-employed attorney. 
Education: Graduate of Capital University School of Law; graduate of Ohio State University with a bachelor’s degree in science; graduate of   
Family: Wife, Anna; three children. 
Priority: To continue to work together with other local government entities to realize economies of scale with respect to paving and other infrastructure maintenance improvements ... it is essential that we continue to focus on securing grant money for township projects. 
DAVID KNARR 
Address: 5202 S. Turner Road, Canfield. 
Employment: Lane Family Funeral Homes and Lane LifeTrans Paramedics. 
Education: Graduate of Walsh University with bachelor’s degrees in communication arts and general business; graduate of   
Family: Two children. 
Priority: To listen to the voice of the township residents and act upon those concerns. I hear almost every day from folks who are frustrated that so many projects seem to go unfinished. The infrastructure of the township is a major concern to almost everyone I talk to. 
ANTHONY (TONY) BETTILE 
Age: 56 
Address: 1380 Fox Den Trail, Canfield. 
Employment: President of Buckeye Lawn Service Inc. and president of Storage and More of Canfield Inc. 
Education: Graduate of Boardman High School. 
Family: Wife; two children. 
Priority: To assist the township in making our tax dollars go further without decreasing services or efficiency by formulating more partnerships, and exploring new sources for grants and low or no-interest loans to assist in infrastructure improvement and equipment purchases. 
JOE PALOSKI 
Address: 3663 Tippecanoe Place, Canfield. 
Employment: Program assistant for SNAP-Education Ohio State University Extension, Mahoning County. 
Education: Graduate of Youngstown State University with a master’s degree in history; graduate of Youngstown State University with a bachelor’s degree in political science. 
Family: Single. 
Priority: I   employee to double our road department’s efforts in repairing our neglected infrastructure. ... I will apply for grants to secure extra funding for equipment and projects we urgently need. 
SCHOOL BOARD
